parameters.doc:
holds value of iptables -A parameter.
                  Possible values are: 'INPUT', 'FORWARD', 'OUTPUT', 'PREROUTING', 'POSTROUTING'.
                  Default value is 'INPUT'  Valid values are `INPUT`, `FORWARD`, `OUTPUT`, `PREROUTING`, `POSTROUTING`.
parameters.name: chain

parameters.doc:
one of the following tables: 'nat', 'mangle',
                  'filter' and 'raw'. Default one is 'filter'  Valid values are `nat`, `mangle`, `filter`, `raw`.
parameters.name: table

parameters.doc:
holds value of iptables --protocol parameter.
                  Possible values are: 'tcp', 'udp', 'icmp', 'esp', 'ah', 'vrrp', 'igmp', 'all'.
                  Default value is 'tcp'  Valid values are `tcp`, `udp`, `icmp`, `esp`, `ah`, `vrrp`, `igmp`, `all`.
parameters.name: proto

parameters.doc:
holds value of iptables --jump target
                  Possible values are: 'ACCEPT', 'DROP', 'REJECT', 'DNAT', 'SNAT', 'LOG', 'MASQUERADE', 'REDIRECT'.
                  Default value is 'ACCEPT'. While this is not the accepted norm, this is the more commonly used jump target.
                  Users should ensure they do an explicit DROP for all packets after all the ACCEPT rules are specified.  Valid values are `ACCEPT`, `DROP`, `REJECT`, `DNAT`, `SNAT`, `LOG`, `MASQUERADE`, `REDIRECT`.
parameters.name: jump

parameters.doc:
value for iptables --source parameter.
                  Accepts a single string or array.
parameters.name: source

parameters.doc:
holds value of iptables [..] --source-port parameter.
                  If array is specified, values will be passed to multiport module.
                  Only applies to tcp/udp.
parameters.name: sport

parameters.doc:
holds value of iptables [..] --destination-port parameter.
                  If array is specified, values will be passed to multiport module.
                  Only applies to tcp/udp.
parameters.name: dport

parameters.doc:
value for iptables '-m state --state' parameter.
                  Possible values are: 'INVALID', 'ESTABLISHED', 'NEW', 'RELATED'.
                  Also accepts an array of multiple values.
parameters.name: state

parameters.doc:
value for iptables '-m limit --limit' parameter.
                  Example values are: '50/sec', '40/min', '30/hour', '10/day'.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.doc:
value for '--limit-burst' parameter.
                  Example values are: '5', '10'.
parameters.name: burst
